3564.title: [#tara-label-P1] [#tara-label-bug] [#tara-label-WorkDrawer] Major [#tara-label-performance] issue on workdrawer data
3564.author: 0ZpXmyPNYbWhd7yL4yM5oPfwoxn2
3564.description:
Work Drawer Controller has a major performance issue. 

​

The Work Drawer controller is calling \`getRequirements(orgId)\`. The huge problem here is we will be loading all archieved Requirements that 99% of the time will never be used.

​

Instead of using \`getRequirements\` with just an orgId, we need a function that loads only the minimal set of data that's needed by the UI. Something like this:

​

![image](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/tara-cloud.appspot.com/o/orgs%2Ftara-ai%2Ftasks%2F3564%2Fimage-d82dafb8-bdc8-49d5-bc4e-b27f91dad3b0.png?alt=media&token=ea93d3ff-6745-43f8-b21b-0073c585b08a)

​

Currently in the repo we're using the useState. We load massive amounts of data. Then we do a post filte after the data is loaded. So 99% of the data is thrown away and never used by anything.


Also these useState filters must be in Redux. We need them to persist when switching between define, sprint and progress as each of those pages will have a different set of filters that need to not change just because you moved to another page. 

![image](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/tara-cloud.appspot.com/o/orgs%2Ftara-ai%2Ftasks%2F3564%2Fimage-204dde04-e936-4be3-a07b-7e428ffeb97b.png?alt=media&token=c3443054-b3c1-4882-a4f6-d847025a8b6e)

3566.description:
Ask me more about this, @tara-user-HRaa28VX4sdrlfTSfF8Lm6nkcxo1 but it has to do with the fact that we need a way for people to add comments. For now, what I'm proposing is that we either:

a) change the "view/open/edit in define mode" to "view/edit details" and what this brings up is a slimmed down version of the task modal which only has the text editor and commenting. no subtasks, status, effort, nothing else. and no navigation arrows to the left and right .

b) the other option is to add a second button. one says view details the other says, "view in define mode" so we start training people to go there, but we also give them the option to view the task.

we can talk about the rationale but the use case is simple. I'm in define mode, I want to add a comment to a task. right now, the task details panel send you to define mode. in define mode there is no commenting.

how do i add a comment. because we de-scoped commenting, we neeed a temporary way of adding commenting until we build it. plus it leaves people with a temporary way of getting used to the new UX and not missing the full editor capabilities too much. we can study to see how many people still use it and THEN discontinue it when we've monitored. in fact, if it's not getting int he way,maybe it always stays. open on that.

feel free to ping me with questions, but this is a high priority to design and get into the works with an engineer.
3566.title: [#tara-label-P1] [#tara-label-design] [#tara-label-enhancement] Add ability to view a slimmed-down version of the task modal

3617.description:
We need to make the way scrollbars are styled throughout the app more consistent. this is a stepping stone towards that.

​

the scrollbar to the work drawer was "added" to the total specified width of the work drawer. This is the desired placement. The scrollbar on the sprint columns was places on the inside so it forces drag and dropped cards to reflow. We want to avoid this behavior.

​

@tara-user-BsKw5inAG8QDkMKg1JCqiAS9rKa2 This are designs for the scrollbars:

​

## Scrollbar component speced out is here: [https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=6314%3A606](https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=6314%3A606)

​

Scrollbars applied to sprint board view: [https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=6306%3A38](https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=6306%3A38)

​

Scrollbar applied to the Define text editor:

[https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=5252%3A52](https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=5252%3A52)

​

Custom scroll bars should be supported on browsers that have CSS scroll properties. For browsers that don't support them we should just use OS defaults. Chrome does support CSS scroll bars which is the main browser of our customer base. Please also validate Windows as well as OSX. -- Bobby

​

Part 1

For the top one:

1. Match line height of input to spec (reduce the line height on dev)

[https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=4952%3A13](https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=4952%3A13)

1. Match the color of the input from black to dark grey
2. **+N is not creating an estimate total, check with Bobby on the plugin that's supposed to be activated. if this is too much for this PR, we have an open ticket for the estimation bug, just ping me in the comments, strike this through, and i'll keep the other one open**
3. ~~Disable hover cursor over enter icon (return arrow) because nothing is in the input~~
4. **Turn the blue selected state of a previously selected work drawer element into a medium dark gray (949CAF) which suggests to the user that while they are creating a task, the previously selected item WHICH STILL REMAINS LOADED IN THE SPRINT DETAILS PANEL**
5. ~~Add a momentary blue pulse or highlight (see the use case write up below)~~

​

​

use case

a) task 123 is selected in the work drawer and is displayed in the text editor and details panel. it is selected in a blue outline.

b) when the user goes to create a new task, the blue selection of the selected task goes to

the blue moves to the input for new task. when the user creates the new task,

the blue outline moves to highlight new task that was created very similar to how we do a green momentary pulse around the task folder when we creater a new task.

this state only lasts for a very brief moment, after which the grey highlight around the previously selected task (previous before the create task sequence was initiated) goes from 949CAF back to blue.

​

​

Part 2

In-line task creation within a requirement where a task already exists

Remove the line that says shortcut hints. that's all

change the focus state to blue, follow the same pulse and switch to grey sequence from above

​

​

Part 3

For requirements that do not have any tasks, remove the existing component that is being used and replace it with the one from in-line creation. So in other words, don't show the task number because we can't seem to get the styling right and there's a bug in the task numbering that will need to be fixed so the cheapest thing is to use the component from part 2

​

repeat the gray blue focus sequence

​

​

Part 4

​

Final piece

Match the input of all the inputs to be the same. for create new task it should all be the same color and size

and then for

create requirement, it should be the same color and size.

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

for the input that appears in a new requirement:

​

​

1. The word task fhould be in all caps since that is what it turns into when you commit the task
2. in this version of the component, we do not need the line that says @ to assign.... to estimate"

3.

and when they add a task inline with a requirement, we shoul duse the same rationale for moving the blue selection state from teh requirement to the creatre task input and the requirement stays seldcted in the gray that we specified above, the new task pulses with a blue highlight for a brief milisecond and then the requirement returns to a blue selectes tate.

​

​

​

​

​

3712.author: b7GIfV40jhMWZjGl4GtnQbh7t4i2
3712.description:
​

Update to 2.0

**to a more sustainable format and update with 2.0 positoning**

​

​

​

​

​

​

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_-

​

This update to onboardings should meet the following requirements:

​

1) Team Tara should be able to easily update onboarding flows in the future because we will move away from a mock app with interactions built into and into a format that is more of a slide-show. Copy on the right with a next button or CTA and then an image on the right. This will make it easier to both updated and customize this onboarding for different types of users.

​

2) the goal of our onboarding 1.0 was to describe at the most basic level WHAT Tara was for. People would join, land in home and not really figure it out quickly. So we created this onboarding and then switched the default page to Sprint.

​

++Easy enough, right? Why change it.++

Well, the product has changed significantly. AND now that our UX is starting to do more of the heavy lifting for us (it's easier for people to figure out what Tara is for, our objectives have evolved.

​

The requirements with regards to the onboarding is that it communicate:

​

1.

**Tara's product positioning**: "Make simplicity your superpower.

Collaborate as a team, from idea to pull request, in one platform" and "The most powerful free plan in project management. All-in-one requirement docs, sprinting, tasks, and progress reporting - **all tied to source control."**

​

**This is the purpose of onboarding -- to explain at a high level HOW to actualize that value as quickly as possible.**

​

**So, we want to give pieces of information that help to orient the user, but then we want them to take an action or to understand HOW to do that particular step.**

​

​

​

1. **A story that educates and compels.**

Let's come up with the storyboard FIRST (the story arc, # of steps, etc. and THEN we can focus on copy and the accompanying image and copy. Please put together a very schematic wireframe -- literally sentences -- of what the steps will be. Example. Step 1: value prop, step 2 create workspace, step 2 b: tell us what your role is and number of people in your org;step 3, explain define, step 4 explain sprint, step 5 explain progress & connection to git, mention connectiont to Slack. Step 6 share.

step 3, explain define, step 4 explain sprint, step 5 exp of steps, etc. and THEN we can focus on copy and the accompanying image and copy. Please put together a very schematic wireframe -- literally sentences -- of what the steps will be. Example. Step 1: value prop, step 2 create workspace, step 2 b: tell us what your role is and number of people in your orgstep 3, explain define, step 4 explain sprint, step 5 explain progress & connection to git, mention connectiont to Slack. Step 6 share.

I think that's about as many steps as we can have.

​

this is my take but I welcome your thoughts on how to streamline and minimzie the number of steps. What I want is for people to understand the nav and WHY the application is structured this way. It's the product development platform that helps you move from idea to done -- with the rest of your team.

​

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

3.

This new onboarding will _**eventually**_ be paired with a set of "system cards" or "system todos" that encourages the user to actually learn Tara while performing simple tasks. Example: We want you to set up an integration, so we tell you it's possible in onbarding, and when you log into Tara there is a Requirement Pre-Made called "Set up Tara" and it has tasks inside of it that can be assigned to system administrators to help you connect Slack and Git. In fact, the task cards are linked to the place in the app where you perform integrations and the body of the requirement / doc have pictures of what you do -- easily and quickly, to get that integration going.

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​
3712.title: [#tara-label-P1] [#tara-label-enhancement] [#tara-label-design] Update onboarding

3723.author: JM1rJtbXFaPcQ6cqF734u54MqGa2
3723.description:
@tara-user-vTUnJr75rdM72HUmz2ebxhLRdzE3 There are 3 use cases we need to fix on the scroll for the work drawer. Can you start on this on Monday 6/7?

​

**Use Case 1 - No jump on selection**

When a user selects an item in the work drawer it should NOT change the scroll position.

​

**Use Case 2 - Cold Boot**

When a user cold boots (reload, copy/paste URL) to the Define/Sprint with an item selected, the selected item should appear in the middle of the work drawer without any animation. 

_Note: As on 6/6 most of this works, the work drawer does have the item selected and visible __++but it's not in the middle of the scroll.++_

​

**Use Case 3 - Returning from Progress (or any other page)**

When a user: 

1. Is on Define/Sprint with an item selected,

2. navigates to another page, like progress,

3. navigates back to the Define/Sprint pages 

4. then the selected item should still be in a selected state and appear in the middle of the word drawer without any animation. 

​

Repo step:

1. Go to the define page. example: [https://app.tara.ai/tara-ai/team-tara/requirement](https://app.tara.ai/tara-ai/team-tara/requirement)

2. Click an item in the work drawer and an item. example: [https://app.tara.ai/tara-ai/team-tara/requirement/rZVDTfbBv6uWQYDZLiW](https://app.tara.ai/tara-ai/team-tara/requirement/rZVDTfbBv6uWQYDZLiWg)

3. Click on sprint tab.

4. Click on define and the URL should go to [https://app.tara.ai/tara-ai/team-tara/requirement/rZVDTfbBv6uWQYDZLiW](https://app.tara.ai/tara-ai/team-tara/requirement/rZVDTfbBv6uWQYDZLiWg) but it goes to [https://app.tara.ai/tara-ai/team-tara/requirement](https://app.tara.ai/tara-ai/team-tara/requirement/rZVDTfbBv6uWQYDZLiWg)

3753.author: 0ZpXmyPNYbWhd7yL4yM5oPfwoxn2
3753.description:
Current: When I add an item from the inline creation box it prepends to the first item in the list.

Expected: When I add an item it should insert at the index of the creation box.

Side note: This is tricky. Many times we are not showing all the items in the list. The Move Task action has to deal with this a lot. There is a until called \`insertNear\` [https://github.com/TARAAI/tara-js/blob/development/microservices/app/src/tools/helpers/array.ts](https://github.com/TARAAI/tara-js/blob/development/microservices/app/src/tools/helpers/array.ts) we must use that so insertion is uniform.

Check out the DND component on how to use the API when changing tasks. [https://github.com/TARAAI/tara-js/blob/619cb2b4ec27ea0f7886e3ada86a11581fdbc0f2/microservices/app/src/components/app/DragAndDrop/Dnd.tsx#L62-L91](https://github.com/TARAAI/tara-js/blob/619cb2b4ec27ea0f7886e3ada86a11581fdbc0f2/microservices/app/src/components/app/DragAndDrop/Dnd.tsx#L62-L91)


Out of scope: We don't order the unordered task. Yes it will feel like a bug but we will not do that right now.

3754.description:
Inline create is slow when adding a task. It's because the createTask action is using the old Firestore Document References. Please change it to the mutate function so it can have it show up instantly with the optimistic updates.

Take note that this action supports a transaction. Let's make sure any other action that's using this gets updated as well. (Meaning this task might take some time)

3878.title: [#tara-label-taskcard] [#tara-label-sprint-columns] [#tara-label-P1] [#tara-label-WorkDrawer] ** Done tasks in sprint columns should assume the same level of opacity and italicization as tasks that are in doing in the work drawer.**
3878.description:
A card should "gray out" in opacity when it has been moved to a sprint, that way a user can easily scan the work drawer when it has a long long list of cards and quickly "know" what is being sprint on, and what is done.

​

The second situation in which is grays out is in the sprint columns when it is marked as done. These are related, but separate behaviors that are meant to follow one pattern: let users quickly scan-find the things that are most important for them to focus on.

​

​

​

This task includes:

Ensuring the opacity of the cards is correct when they are moved to a sprint

​

Here is the spec for how cards should look and behave in the work drawer:

[https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=1349%3A14020](https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=1349%3A14020)

​

​

​

Add opacity change for cards that are done in sprint columns

[https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=622%3A0](https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=622%3A0)

3898.title: Should "current" be greyed out?
3898.author: u83CGZwusdaS32hkaTjThNrASeA3
3898.description:
Changes

​

Make the Word "current" the same color as the header box that is underneath it (the blue /indigo)

​

Then... when the user is NOT on the current sprint, the copy in the central part of this component should actually say "Go to Current" and it should be the in the "focus blue" that is used for label colors since it denotes a call to action.

​

​

​

​

​

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

​

Small nitpick, but at first glance it's not immediately obvious that this is the "current" sprint since its greyed out.

​

Since this is the current sprint, and technically unclickable, should it be greyed out? Makes me, the user, think this isn't the current sprint since it's greyed out. Should we make it green or the same color as the sprint heading box (ie blue?)

​

![image](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/tara-cloud.appspot.com/o/orgs%2Ftara-ai%2Ftasks%2F3898%2Fimage-f26292c7-cd37-4f05-a643-f8ed173053c0.png?alt=media&token=90dd4c3c-f0f4-4587-a188-c6a8851fd63d)

​

Conversely, seeing current not greyed out makes me think at first glance, that this is the "current" sprint, even though it's not:

​

![image](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/tara-cloud.appspot.com/o/orgs%2Ftara-ai%2Ftasks%2F3898%2Fimage-5ac2d67d-2d3e-425d-b3ba-d50d7c860535.png?alt=media&token=91e348c6-0a78-4209-9a39-46439470a58c)

​

​

4135.author: 7PVaq3IAtSh9fwMMdyQZ7Cp0Fm33
4135.description:
**To Replicate:**

1. Log into Staging

2. Create a new workspace

3. In the step where you have to create tasks, add 3 tasks which have long task titles above 10 words or more.

4. Click on Move Tasks

5. The onboarding will load forever and not hit the sprints page. (This behaviour only happens sometimes but the console shows permission issues) 

​

Please watch attached video for reference.

​

**The Fix:**

1. No matter how long the the task title is, the onboarding should proceed without errors

2. The user shouldn't have to refresh on onboarding after entering a long task title

3. There should be no permission errors on new workspace creation 

​

​
4135.title: [#tara-label-sev3] [#tara-label-bug] [#tara-label-v2.37.0] Onbaording gives permission error and infinite loads on long task title

4136.description:
**To Replicate:**

1. Go to Staging or even in Production here. For staging have a populated sprint board and workspace, if you don't have access to one, please ping me (Syed) 

2. Start typing a task description. Type about 10-12 words and general, wait for 1-2 seconds. Then type fast again and the text editor lags and attempts to catch up with the type. 

3. If you follow this start and stop and start behaviour you can easily reproduce this issue

​

**The Fix:**

1. Regardless of the start/stop/start behavior of the user typing, the editor should not stutter or lag. 

​

If there is no fast fix for this or there are solutions that will take longer than 24 hours to implement, please ping me (Syed) directly.
4136.title: [#tara-label-sev3] [#tara-label-bug] [#tara-label-v2.37.0] Sluggish Text Editor Performance on stop/start typing

4240.title: [#tara-label-P2] [#tara-label-Tara2.0] Deleting a task redirects to last visited page

4241.description:
Expected behavior:

When the user clicks into the task title, we surface a version of the input which has alternate text "Edit task title."

​

What is needed, I believe, in order to get this working as expected are the following actions:

​

if the user navigates away from the input, but has not entered anything, we revert to the original task title. We do this since all tasks should have titles and until the user specifies a character, we have nothing to rename the task.

​

If the user wants to delete the task, they always have the option to delete the task.

If the user DOES create a task title change, and then navigates away, we should accept that title change and change it on the sprint board, the work drawer, the text editor, and anywhere else the task title appears.

​

​

​

**Env: **Dev

​

​

**Steps:**

1. Create new task

**2. **Open it

1. Delete task title

​

**Result:**

Task title input looks like task creation input

​

​

![image](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/tara-cloud.appspot.com/o/orgs%2Ftara-ai%2Ftasks%2F4241%2Fimage-fdceb8f5-7936-4382-a54d-ad438deda981.png?alt=media&token=8e444384-7223-4780-8c54-2386c669e13e)

​

<----More details after testing this ------>

There is more depth to this bug rather than just the task creation box being visible when all the characters are deleted.

Attached is the video and an image of other tasks for clearer understanding:

When I click on the second task and delete all characters in the task title, it now shows me an empty task creation box - which is ok. but when I open the first task in the side panel that too shows me an empty task creation box.![image](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/tara-cloud.appspot.com/o/orgs%2Ftara-ai%2Ftasks%2F4241%2FScreen%20Shot%202021-07-08%20at%202.07.59%20PM-5eaf22e3-44a6-4a80-af19-de77a6fafa87.png?alt=media&token=cfde8e01-edd3-4f12-9079-d65dfaa2bee1)

4371.author: 0ZpXmyPNYbWhd7yL4yM5oPfwoxn2
4371.description:
Task details and requirement details URLs need to be unchanged when the user is on 2.0. When the workspace's `newSprintsPage` feature flag is on the URLs for the details pages include '/define'. We need to remove that.

​

Task/Requirement detail pages should be the same URL but show different views whether a workspace is on the new 2.0 or not. 

​

We will be doing a phased rollout so both 1.0 and 2.0 should work properly. Once everyone is on 2.0 we'll delete the old code. 

​

task url should be: `/{workspaceId}/{teamId}/tasks/{taskId}`

requirement url should be:` /{workspaceId}/{teamId}/requirements/{requirementId}`
4371.title: [#tara-label-P2] Unify details URLs for 2.0 & 1. 0

ordered.description: Currently to show the repository tasks we are loading all tasks with external issues. Instead we should load the \`products\` document to get a list of repo Tier 2 sections. When someone clicks on the Repo Tier 2 section then we should load just the tasks for the repo.

Issue: When the page loads its not showing any tasks on sections that are open.

​

Note that is DOES work if a task is active in the URL. Like this: [https://app.dev.tara.ai/tara-ai/team-tara/sprints?type=sprint&active=N82bnH67ialiyerrAVIV](https://app.dev.tara.ai/tara-ai/team-tara/sprints?type=sprint&active=N82bnH67ialiyerrAVIV)

​

It does NOT work when I cold boot to sprints with no query params or the query params have a sprint acitve. Like [https://app.dev.tara.ai/tara-ai/team-tara/sprints?type=sprint&active=N82bnH67ialiyerrAVIV](https://app.dev.tara.ai/tara-ai/team-tara/sprints?type=sprint&active=N82bnH67ialiyerrAVIV) or [https://app.dev.tara.ai/tara-ai/team-tara/sprints](https://app.dev.tara.ai/tara-ai/team-tara/sprints). Same with Define mode when no requirement is included. Like: [https://app.dev.tara.ai/tara-ai/team-tara/define/requirements](https://app.dev.tara.ai/tara-ai/team-tara/define/requirements)

​

ordered.title: [#tara-label-bug] [#tara-label-WorkDrawer] open sections don't load on cold boot

ordered.description:
Expected behavior:

When the user clicks into the task title, we surface a version of the input which has alternate text "Edit task title."

​

What is needed, I believe, in order to get this working as expected are the following actions:

​

if the user navigates away from the input, but has not entered anything, we revert to the original task title. We do this since all tasks should have titles and until the user specifies a character, we have nothing to rename the task.

​

If the user wants to delete the task, they always have the option to delete the task.

If the user DOES create a task title change, and then navigates away, we should accept that title change and change it on the sprint board, the work drawer, the text editor, and anywhere else the task title appears.

​

​

​

**Env: **Dev

​

​

**Steps:**

1. Create new task

**2. **Open it

1. Delete task title

​

**Result:**

Task title input looks like task creation input

​

​

![image](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/tara-cloud.appspot.com/o/orgs%2Ftara-ai%2Ftasks%2F4241%2Fimage-fdceb8f5-7936-4382-a54d-ad438deda981.png?alt=media&token=8e444384-7223-4780-8c54-2386c669e13e)

​

<----More details after testing this ------>

There is more depth to this bug rather than just the task creation box being visible when all the characters are deleted.

Attached is the video and an image of other tasks for clearer understanding:

When I click on the second task and delete all characters in the task title, it now shows me an empty task creation box - which is ok. but when I open the first task in the side panel that too shows me an empty task creation box.![image](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/tara-cloud.appspot.com/o/orgs%2Ftara-ai%2Ftasks%2F4241%2FScreen%20Shot%202021-07-08%20at%202.07.59%20PM-5eaf22e3-44a6-4a80-af19-de77a6fafa87.png?alt=media&token=cfde8e01-edd3-4f12-9079-d65dfaa2bee1)

ordered.description:
**To Replicate:**

1. Go to Staging or even in Production here. For staging have a populated sprint board and workspace, if you don't have access to one, please ping me (Syed) 

2. Start typing a task description. Type about 10-12 words and general, wait for 1-2 seconds. Then type fast again and the text editor lags and attempts to catch up with the type. 

3. If you follow this start and stop and start behaviour you can easily reproduce this issue

​

**The Fix:**

1. Regardless of the start/stop/start behavior of the user typing, the editor should not stutter or lag. 

​

If there is no fast fix for this or there are solutions that will take longer than 24 hours to implement, please ping me (Syed) directly.

ordered.description:
**To Replicate:**

1. Log into Staging

2. Create a new workspace

3. In the step where you have to create tasks, add 3 tasks which have long task titles above 10 words or more.

4. Click on Move Tasks

5. The onboarding will load forever and not hit the sprints page. (This behaviour only happens sometimes but the console shows permission issues) 

​

Please watch attached video for reference.

​

**The Fix:**

1. No matter how long the the task title is, the onboarding should proceed without errors

2. The user shouldn't have to refresh on onboarding after entering a long task title

3. There should be no permission errors on new workspace creation 

​

​

Changes

ordered.title: [#tara-label-taskcard] [#tara-label-sprint-columns] [#tara-label-P1] [#tara-label-WorkDrawer] ** Done tasks in sprint columns should assume the same level of opacity and italicization as tasks that are in doing in the work drawer.**
ordered.description:
A card should "gray out" in opacity when it has been moved to a sprint, that way a user can easily scan the work drawer when it has a long long list of cards and quickly "know" what is being sprint on, and what is done.

​

The second situation in which is grays out is in the sprint columns when it is marked as done. These are related, but separate behaviors that are meant to follow one pattern: let users quickly scan-find the things that are most important for them to focus on.

​

​

​

This task includes:

Ensuring the opacity of the cards is correct when they are moved to a sprint

​

Here is the spec for how cards should look and behave in the work drawer:

[https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=1349%3A14020](https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=1349%3A14020)

​

​

​

Add opacity change for cards that are done in sprint columns

[https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=622%3A0](https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=622%3A0)

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

Here, Task-238 is in italics, not sure why. I didn't italicize the heading when adding the task. Not sure if this is a bug.

When a new user installs the github app for the first time. The users imported issues are not shown in the toast and the user is redirected to the home page.

How it should work:

When a new user install the github app for the first time, the user should be redirected back to the sprints page and then shown the toast that indicates how many issues are being imported.

ordered.author: 0ZpXmyPNYbWhd7yL4yM5oPfwoxn2
ordered.description:
1. Remove the pencil icon.

​

2. When double-clicking the title text it should switch to edit mode just like it does in the sidebar for the task title.

​

3. onEnter it should save the task title change.

​

4. When editing a task card, we don't need any of the hint text that shows in the create task box at the top of the work drawer. Just have the basic UI.

Right now when a single click on the title switches to edit mode. 

​

# **New functionality: Switching to edit mode should be a double-click instead.**

​

We will be using this component in more use cases so it needs to be consistent across the app. 

​

[https://github.com/TARAAI/tara-js/blob/development/microservices/app/src/components/app/TaskDetails/Title/Title.tsx#L92-L107](https://github.com/TARAAI/tara-js/blob/development/microservices/app/src/components/app/TaskDetails/Title/Title.tsx#L92-L107)

ordered.description:
Current: When I add an item from the inline creation box it prepends to the first item in the list.

Expected: When I add an item it should insert at the index of the creation box.

Side note: This is tricky. Many times we are not showing all the items in the list. The Move Task action has to deal with this a lot. There is a until called \`insertNear\` [https://github.com/TARAAI/tara-js/blob/development/microservices/app/src/tools/helpers/array.ts](https://github.com/TARAAI/tara-js/blob/development/microservices/app/src/tools/helpers/array.ts) we must use that so insertion is uniform.

Check out the DND component on how to use the API when changing tasks. [https://github.com/TARAAI/tara-js/blob/619cb2b4ec27ea0f7886e3ada86a11581fdbc0f2/microservices/app/src/components/app/DragAndDrop/Dnd.tsx#L62-L91](https://github.com/TARAAI/tara-js/blob/619cb2b4ec27ea0f7886e3ada86a11581fdbc0f2/microservices/app/src/components/app/DragAndDrop/Dnd.tsx#L62-L91)


Out of scope: We don't order the unordered task. Yes it will feel like a bug but we will not do that right now.

Current: When clicking the inline add button it just adds but i have to click the input box to start typing.

​

Expected: When I click the inline create button it should create the box inline and automatically focus on the input.

ordered.description:
@tara-user-vTUnJr75rdM72HUmz2ebxhLRdzE3 There are 3 use cases we need to fix on the scroll for the work drawer. Can you start on this on Monday 6/7?

​

**Use Case 1 - No jump on selection**

When a user selects an item in the work drawer it should NOT change the scroll position.

​

**Use Case 2 - Cold Boot**

When a user cold boots (reload, copy/paste URL) to the Define/Sprint with an item selected, the selected item should appear in the middle of the work drawer without any animation. 

_Note: As on 6/6 most of this works, the work drawer does have the item selected and visible __++but it's not in the middle of the scroll.++_

​

**Use Case 3 - Returning from Progress (or any other page)**

When a user: 

1. Is on Define/Sprint with an item selected,

2. navigates to another page, like progress,

3. navigates back to the Define/Sprint pages 

4. then the selected item should still be in a selected state and appear in the middle of the word drawer without any animation. 

​
ordered.title: [#tara-label-WorkDrawer] [#tara-label-P1] [#tara-label-bug] Selecting a work drawer item should not move the scroll.

ordered.author: b7GIfV40jhMWZjGl4GtnQbh7t4i2
ordered.description:
​

Update to 2.0

**to a more sustainable format and update with 2.0 positoning**

​

​

​

​

​

​

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_-

​

This update to onboardings should meet the following requirements:

​

1) Team Tara should be able to easily update onboarding flows in the future because we will move away from a mock app with interactions built into and into a format that is more of a slide-show. Copy on the right with a next button or CTA and then an image on the right. This will make it easier to both updated and customize this onboarding for different types of users.

​

2) the goal of our onboarding 1.0 was to describe at the most basic level WHAT Tara was for. People would join, land in home and not really figure it out quickly. So we created this onboarding and then switched the default page to Sprint.

​

++Easy enough, right? Why change it.++

Well, the product has changed significantly. AND now that our UX is starting to do more of the heavy lifting for us (it's easier for people to figure out what Tara is for, our objectives have evolved.

​

The requirements with regards to the onboarding is that it communicate:

​

1.

**Tara's product positioning**: "Make simplicity your superpower.

Collaborate as a team, from idea to pull request, in one platform" and "The most powerful free plan in project management. All-in-one requirement docs, sprinting, tasks, and progress reporting - **all tied to source control."**

​

**This is the purpose of onboarding -- to explain at a high level HOW to actualize that value as quickly as possible.**

​

**So, we want to give pieces of information that help to orient the user, but then we want them to take an action or to understand HOW to do that particular step.**

​

​

​

1. **A story that educates and compels.**

Let's come up with the storyboard FIRST (the story arc, # of steps, etc. and THEN we can focus on copy and the accompanying image and copy. Please put together a very schematic wireframe -- literally sentences -- of what the steps will be. Example. Step 1: value prop, step 2 create workspace, step 2 b: tell us what your role is and number of people in your org;step 3, explain define, step 4 explain sprint, step 5 explain progress & connection to git, mention connectiont to Slack. Step 6 share.

step 3, explain define, step 4 explain sprint, step 5 exp of steps, etc. and THEN we can focus on copy and the accompanying image and copy. Please put together a very schematic wireframe -- literally sentences -- of what the steps will be. Example. Step 1: value prop, step 2 create workspace, step 2 b: tell us what your role is and number of people in your orgstep 3, explain define, step 4 explain sprint, step 5 explain progress & connection to git, mention connectiont to Slack. Step 6 share.

I think that's about as many steps as we can have.

​

this is my take but I welcome your thoughts on how to streamline and minimzie the number of steps. What I want is for people to understand the nav and WHY the application is structured this way. It's the product development platform that helps you move from idea to done -- with the rest of your team.

​

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

3.

This new onboarding will _**eventually**_ be paired with a set of "system cards" or "system todos" that encourages the user to actually learn Tara while performing simple tasks. Example: We want you to set up an integration, so we tell you it's possible in onbarding, and when you log into Tara there is a Requirement Pre-Made called "Set up Tara" and it has tasks inside of it that can be assigned to system administrators to help you connect Slack and Git. In fact, the task cards are linked to the place in the app where you perform integrations and the body of the requirement / doc have pictures of what you do -- easily and quickly, to get that integration going.

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

The rules around italicization are:

​

When a new card is created, it in the work drawer, it is NOT in italics. It is just in plain font.

​

When a task is moved to the work Drawer the card that is now in the sprint drawer is in regular font, not italics. that's because it's the "live" card

​

the thing that goes into italics and screen back in opacity is the ghost of the card that sits in the work drawer.

​

ordered.author: b7GIfV40jhMWZjGl4GtnQbh7t4i2
ordered.description:
The reason for changing the height of the requirement card is to facilitate proper drag & drop functionality. Currently, dragging a card to a requirement is problematic if not impossible unless the height of the target requirement is at least the height of the card which the user is attempting to move.

​

Conversation with @tara-user-o4yyzJztJzg546ggMrWBjMX2dyw2 on May 11 highlighted this, so @tara-user-HRaa28VX4sdrlfTSfF8Lm6nkcxo1 is going to alter the design and we will then assign it once it's ready.

​

After speaking with Cisco we would like to also update the requirement card to show the effort count instead of the task count on the requirement card.

​

**New 2nd Tier item size:**

[https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=5573%3A4](https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=5573%3A4)

We need to make the way scrollbars are styled throughout the app more consistent. this is a stepping stone towards that.

​

the scrollbar to the work drawer was "added" to the total specified width of the work drawer. This is the desired placement. The scrollbar on the sprint columns was places on the inside so it forces drag and dropped cards to reflow. We want to avoid this behavior.

​

@tara-user-BsKw5inAG8QDkMKg1JCqiAS9rKa2 This are designs for the scrollbars:

​

## Scrollbar component speced out is here: [https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=6314%3A606](https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=6314%3A606)

​

Scrollbars applied to sprint board view: [https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=6306%3A38](https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=6306%3A38)

​

Scrollbar applied to the Define text editor:

[https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=5252%3A52](https://www.figma.com/file/TuF1X0AlGCHB2MpGISrrHH/Tara-App-UI?node-id=5252%3A52)

​

Custom scroll bars should be supported on browsers that have CSS scroll properties. For browsers that don't support them we should just use OS defaults. Chrome does support CSS scroll bars which is the main browser of our customer base. Please also validate Windows as well as OSX. -- Bobby

We should find a way to set activity author in revision document. Possible implementation solutions to explore:

- create revisions in more imperative way (call createRevision() function in every place where task document is changed) instead of declarative (call createRevision() as trigger for task document changes)
- store separate objects with list of activities which Tara-bot is an author
- **set Tara-bot (or undefined) as lastUpdateAuthor in task document everytime, when task is changed automatically**

ordered.author: S8IDjvROkCaqPkmjyUgCZW8xEnE3

ordered.description:
Ask me more about this, @tara-user-HRaa28VX4sdrlfTSfF8Lm6nkcxo1 but it has to do with the fact that we need a way for people to add comments. For now, what I'm proposing is that we either:

a) change the "view/open/edit in define mode" to "view/edit details" and what this brings up is a slimmed down version of the task modal which only has the text editor and commenting. no subtasks, status, effort, nothing else. and no navigation arrows to the left and right .

b) the other option is to add a second button. one says view details the other says, "view in define mode" so we start training people to go there, but we also give them the option to view the task.

we can talk about the rationale but the use case is simple. I'm in define mode, I want to add a comment to a task. right now, the task details panel send you to define mode. in define mode there is no commenting.

how do i add a comment. because we de-scoped commenting, we neeed a temporary way of adding commenting until we build it. plus it leaves people with a temporary way of getting used to the new UX and not missing the full editor capabilities too much. we can study to see how many people still use it and THEN discontinue it when we've monitored. in fact, if it's not getting int he way,maybe it always stays. open on that.

feel free to ping me with questions, but this is a high priority to design and get into the works with an engineer.
ordered.title: [#tara-label-P1] [#tara-label-design] [#tara-label-enhancement] Add ability to view a slimmed-down version of the task modal

ordered.title: [#tara-label-P1] [#tara-label-bug] [#tara-label-WorkDrawer] Major [#tara-label-performance] issue on workdrawer data
ordered.author: 0ZpXmyPNYbWhd7yL4yM5oPfwoxn2
ordered.description:
Work Drawer Controller has a major performance issue. 

​

The Work Drawer controller is calling \`getRequirements(orgId)\`. The huge problem here is we will be loading all archieved Requirements that 99% of the time will never be used.

​

Instead of using \`getRequirements\` with just an orgId, we need a function that loads only the minimal set of data that's needed by the UI. Something like this:

​

![image](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/tara-cloud.appspot.com/o/orgs%2Ftara-ai%2Ftasks%2F3564%2Fimage-d82dafb8-bdc8-49d5-bc4e-b27f91dad3b0.png?alt=media&token=ea93d3ff-6745-43f8-b21b-0073c585b08a)

​

Currently in the repo we're using the useState. We load massive amounts of data. Then we do a post filte after the data is loaded. So 99% of the data is thrown away and never used by anything.


Also these useState filters must be in Redux. We need them to persist when switching between define, sprint and progress as each of those pages will have a different set of filters that need to not change just because you moved to another page. 

![image](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/tara-cloud.appspot.com/o/orgs%2Ftara-ai%2Ftasks%2F3564%2Fimage-204dde04-e936-4be3-a07b-7e428ffeb97b.png?alt=media&token=c3443054-b3c1-4882-a4f6-d847025a8b6e)

ordered.title: [#tara-label-sprint-columns] [#tara-label-P3] [#tara-label-bug] Task Card when filtering should have colored background

ordered.description:
Summary of Decisions / Conversation
1. We preserve user defined drag and drop orde
2. We show the indicator just below the last overloaded task
3. When a red task is moved into the white zone, we recalculate which cards are red and white








\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

​


When too many tasks are added to the sprint the extra cards at the bottom of the list should be red.

​

On dev

![image](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/tara-cloud.appspot.com/o/orgs%2Ftara-ai%2Ftasks%2F3486%2Fimage-9090a95f-c2b4-492c-ae48-ad3c8cbc25b2.png?alt=media&token=056e9875-e4d1-4804-b49a-1ac5e8126c43)

​

1. Figma shows that the overload bar should be below the last non-overloaded task.
2. All cards below the overload should have a red colored background.
